messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., venkatesh srinivasan <venky_gct@y...> wrote:
> Hi Folks
> I am having a basic question..!
> Why should i go for JUnit testing Framework which i
> can accompolish in plain java class.?
> See what ever i am writing inside a test case funtion
> , i can write it in a plain java class which doesn't
> extend TestCase class?

I think so that by writing your testcases in JUnit
you will be able to automate your testing.

E.g. if you collect all your tests in one
suite method you will test all old tests whenever you
create a new test.

Have you ever found out, that when you correct a bug
somewhere you may just create two new ones. By testing
this way you may find also the new bugs that you did not
at all expect.

Other reasons could be, that JUnit testrunners display
the errors in a standard way. You don't need to read
only the stack-traces from your display.

regagds
Kaarle Kaila
